1.label: Minimum brightness level
1.description: Parameter is set automatically during the calibration process. Options for changing parameter 1-98. Default 1.

2.label: Maximum brightness level
2.description: Parameter is set automatically during the calibration process. Options for changing parameter 2-99. Default 99.

3.label: Incandescence level of dimmable compact fluorescent lamps
3.description: Virtual value set as a percentage level between parameters MIN (1%) and MAX. (99%). The Dimmer will set to this value after first switch on. It is required for warming up and switching dimmable compact fluorescent lamps and certain types of light sources. Options for changing parameter 1-99. Default 1.

4.label: Incandescence time of dimmable compact fluorescent lamps
4.description: This parameter determines the time required for switching compact fluorescent lamps and certain types of light sources. Setting this parameter to 0 will disable the incandescence functionality. Available settings: 0-255 (0s - 25,5s)

5.label: The percentage of a dimming step at automatic control

6.label: Time of a dimming step at automatic control

7.label: The percentage of a dimming step at manual control

8.label: Time of a dimming step at manual control

9.label: Saving state before power failure
9.description: Saving state before power failure. Default 1.

options.label: State NOT saved at power failure, all outputs are set to OFF upon power restore
State saved at power failure, all outputs are set to previous state upon power restore

10.label: Timer functionality (auto - off)
10.description: Available settings: 0 - Function disabled; 1-32767 - time to turn off measured in seconds (1s - 9,1h) Default setting: 0

options.label: ALL ON active / ALL OFF active
ALL ON disabled/ ALL OFF disabled
ALL ON disabled/ ALL OFF active
ALL ON active / ALL OFF disabled

13.label: Force auto-calibration
13.description: Changing value of this parameter will force the calibration process.

options.label: idle
Start auto-calibration of the load without Fibaro Bypass
Start auto-calibration of the load with Fibaro Bypass

14.label: Auto-calibration status
14.description: This parameter determines operating mode of the Dimmer (automatic/manual settings).

options.label: calibration procedure not performed or Dimmer operates on manual settings
Dimmer operates on auto-calibration settings

15.label: Burnt out bulb detection
15.description: Function based on the sudden power variation of a specific value, interpreted as a LOAD ERROR. Available settings: 0 - function disabled; 1-99 - percentage value of power variation, compared to standard power consumption, measured during the calibration procedure (to be interpreted as load error/burnt out bulb) Default setting: 30

16.label: Time delay of a burnt out bulb
16.description: Time of delay (in seconds) for power variation detection, interpreted as a LOAD ERROR or OVERLOAD detection (too much power connected to the Dimmer). Available settings: 0 - detection of a burnt out bulb disabled; 1-255 - delay time in seconds; Default setting: 5

19.label: Forced switch on brightness level
19.description: If the parameter is active, switching on the Dimmer (S1 single click) will always set this brightness level. Available settings: 0 - function disabled; 1-99 - percentage level of brightness; Default setting: 0

options.label: Mono-stable input (button)
Bi-stable input (switch)
Role blind switch (UP / DOWN) - two switch keys operate the Dimmer

21.label: The value sent to associated devices on single click
21.description: The value sent to associated devices on single click.

options.label: 0xFF value is sent, which will set associated devices to their last saved state.
Current Dimmer state is sent, which will synchronize brightness level of associated devices (other Dimmers for example).

22.label: Assign toggle switch status to the device status

options.label: Device changes status on switch status change
Device status is synchronized with switch status
Disable double click
Enable double click

24.label: Command frames sent in 2-nd and 3-rd association groups (S1 associations)

25.label: Command frames sent in 4-th and 5-th association groups (S2 associations)

26.label: The function of 3-way switch
26.description: Switch no. 2 controls the Dimmer additionally (in 3-way switch mode). Function disabled for parameter 20 set to 2 (roller blind switch)

options.label: 3-way switch function for S2 disabled
3-way switch function for S2 enabled

27.label: Associations in Z-Wave network security mode

28.label: Scene activation functionality
28.description: SCENE ID depends on the switch type configurations. Default 0.

options.label: Functionality deactivated
Functionality activated

29.label: Switch functionality of S1 and S2

options.label: standard mode
S1 operates as S2, S2 operates as S1

30.label: Load control mode
30.description: Forced auto-calibration will set this parameter value to 2.

options.label: forced leading edge control
forced trailing edge control
control mode selected automatically (based on auto-calibration)

31.label: Load control mode recognized during auto-calibration
31.description: Load control mode recognized during auto-calibration.

options.label: leading edge
trailing edge

32.label: On/Off mode
32.description: This mode is necessary while connecting non-dimmable light sources. Setting this parameter to 1 automatically ignores brightening/dimming time settings. Forced auto-calibration will set this parameter’s value to 2

options.label: on/off mode disabled (dimming is possible)
on/off mode enabled (dimming is not possible)
mode selected automatically
Load recognized as dimmable
Load recognized as non-dimmable

34.label: Soft-Start functionality
34.description: Time required to warm up the filament of halogen bulb.

options.label: no soft-start
short soft-start (0.1s)
long soft-start (0.5s)

35.label: Auto-calibration after power on
35.description: This parameter determines the trigger of auto-calibration procedure, e.g. power on, load error, etc.

options.label: No auto-calibration of the load after power on
Auto-calibration performed after first power on
Auto-calibration performed after each power on
Auto-calibration performed after first power on or after each LOAD ERROR alarm (no load, load failure, burnt out bulb)
Auto-calibration performed after each power on or after each LOAD ERROR alarm (no load, load failure, burnt out bulb),

37.label: Behaviour of the Dimmer after OVERCURRENT or SURGE
37.description: Behaviour of the Dimmer after OVERCURRENT or SURGE

options.label: device permanently disabled until re-enabling by comand or external switch
three attempts to turn on the load

38.label: Brightness level correction for flickering loads
38.description: Correction reduces spontaneous flickering of some capacitive load (e.g. dimmable lEDs) at certain brightness levels in 2-wire installation. In countries using ripple-control, correction may cause changes in brightness. In this case it is necessary to disable correction or adjust time of correction for flickering loads. Available settings: 0 - automatic correction disabled 1-254 - duration of correction in seconds 255 - automatic correction always enabled Default setting: 255

39.label: Power limit - OVERLOAD
39.description: Reaching the defined value will result in turning off the load. Additional apparent power limit of 350VA is active by default. Available settings: 0 - functionality disabled; 1-350 - 1W-350W; Default setting: 250

40.label: Response to General Purpose Alarm
40.description: Response to General Purpose Alarm; Default 3.

options.label: No reaction - no response to alarm frames
ALARM DIMMER ON - device turn ON upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM DIMMER OFF - device will turn OFF upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM FLASHING - device will turn ON and OFF periodically

41.label: Response to Water Flooding Alarm
41.description: Response to Water Flooding Alarm; Default 2.

options.label: No reaction - no response to alarm frames
ALARM DIMMER ON - device turn ON upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM DIMMER OFF - device will turn OFF upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM FLASHING - device will turn ON and OFF periodically

42.label: Response to Smoke, CO or CO2 Alarm
42.description: Response to Smoke, CO or CO2 Alarm; Default 3.

options.label: No reaction - no response to alarm frames
ALARM DIMMER ON - device turn ON upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM DIMMER OFF - device will turn OFF upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM FLASHING - device will turn ON and OFF periodically
No reaction - no response to alarm frames
ALARM DIMMER ON - device turn ON upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM DIMMER OFF - device will turn OFF upon receipt of alarm frame
ALARM FLASHING - device will turn ON and OFF periodically

44.label: Time of alarm state
44.description: Alarm state may be cancelled earlier, as a result of pressing the switches or sending the Z-Wave command frame.

45.label: OVERLOAD alarm report
45.description: OVERLOAD alarm report (load power consumption too high)

options.label: No reaction
Send an alarm frame

46.label: LOAD ERROR alarm report
46.description: LOAD ERROR alarm report (no load, load failure, burnt out bulb)

options.label: No reaction
Send an alarm frame

47.label: OVERCURRENT alarm report
47.description: OVERCURRENT alarm report (short circuit, burnt out bulb causing overcurrent)

options.label: No reaction
Send an alarm frame
No reaction
Send an alarm frame

49.label: OVERHEAT and VOLTAGE DROP alarm report
49.description: OVERHEAT (critical temperature) and VOLTAGE DROP (low voltage) alarm report

options.label: No reaction
Send an alarm frame

50.label: Active power reports

52.label: Periodic active power and energy reports

53.label: Energy reports

54.label: Self-measurement
54.description: The Dimmer may include active power and energy consumed by itself in reports sent to the main controller.

options.label: Self-measurement inactive
Self-measurement active

58.label: Method of calculating the active power
58.description: This parameter defines how to calculate active power. This parameter is useful in a case of 2-wire connection with light sources other than resistive. The parameter is set to 0 after forced auto-calibration.

options.label: power measurement based on the standard algorithm
approximation based on the calibration data
approximation based on the control angle

59.label: Approximated power at the maximum brightness level
59.description: This parameter determines the approximate value of the power that will be reported by the device at its maximum brightness level. This parameter works only when parameter 58 has a value other than 0. Available settings: 0-500 (0-500W) - power consumed by the load at the maximum brightness level. Default setting: 0
